intro: Carpotroche laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered carpotroche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, grassy areas and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces seeds in achenes. Carpotroche laxiflora is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments.
